comment: Only gave her 4 stars bc she takes sooo long to respond to emails(like up to 3 weeks honestly). But if you can take her, please do- there is no grading rubric or anything. everything is a completion grade honestly! Dont buy the textbook, the whole class is composed of like 8 DB posts, 1 project, and a final for the 7-week course. easist class ever!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment:
***Class is ISD2001*** Dr. Dow makes life VERY simple. There are weekly DQ posts up to 200 words each. The midterm is 10-14 pages!!! It's easier than it sounds. The final is right to the point (I finished it in about 10 minutes).
She won't make your life difficult. You WILL have to read weekly, but this was a very simple class and I learned a lot.

Prof. Dow was very organized and professional in the way she presented and conducted this class.  Material consists of 1 chapter to read each week with an activity (1-2 page double spaced essay or discussion topic) every other week.  2 exams (with two attempts each).  Time required each week was 1-1.5 hours.  Easy A plus interesting.

She doesn't respond to emails in a timely manner, but she is a very lenient grader. The way she grades your overall grade makes no sense if you do all assignments get a 100 and get one B on an exam while getting an A on the other exams you get a B in the class.

Would take this professor again. Took her online for Love & s** class. Occasional quizzes (2 attemp.) and assignments. 2 writing assignments that had to be 2 pages long. Other than that the other assignments are very quick and simple. Allowed the last week to complete any unfinished assignments for credit. Easy class with not much work.

Very nice person, class is easy peasy and you're free to write whatever you want for her two papers. The final exam was the easiest test you'll take if you take 10 minutes to study. Attendance is super important but overall the easiest A in my life. The only con is that half of the class you have nothing to do but you cant leave, but its worth it.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Lots and lots of powerpoints but I did take the class online so that was expected. The professor does NOT respond to emails so if you are struggling or don't understand something, good luck on trying to reach her or figure it out. Easy assignments and I would say there were about 3-4 quizzez/tests including the final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: She doesn't respond to emails in a timely manner, but she is a very lenient grader. There are 3 exam which you have 2 attempts on. The textbook is not needed since she provides a powerpoint with all of the information needed along with note taking guides for each subject. she will assign a 2-page essay during the first two weeks of class.

Assignments were easy but she does not respond to emails. If anything is unclear you just don't get any guidance. As well, she told us the textbook was mandatory and then posted the notes from it, so I bought the book for literally no reason. I wouldn't take this course with Dow if you want a professor who actually teaches.

She was very hard to get a hold of online, never got a response from her anytime I emailed. It's an easy class outside of a random two page paper you get one week to write, but would not take again due to communication issues. Exams are long, but you get multiple attempts.

Super easy A to fulfill gened requirement. Everything is graded for completion, only has 3 tests (no lockdown, 2 attempts, 1st attempt gives you the answers after), and 10 assignments. Grades stay updated regularly. Also gives ability to make up any missed assignments at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: To be honest. I don't know why everyone is trying to complain about reaching out to her. Her class was EASY! I did my work the day of! And still passed. Her explanations were very clear. Everyone wants her to hold their hand by responding to something so clear in the syllabus! Just take her! She's really chilled!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Really easy class to take. She doesn't grade hard on essays and does not assign to much work.

I took the class for the summer online so it was really simple. Every week you had one or two PowerPoints no more than 20 slides each. A quiz and discussion post on the exact PowerPoint no lockdown. I purchased the book but never had to use it. She seems nice but it might take a minute for her to respond to your emails. Tbh her class was breezy.

Professor Dow answered emails quite slowly and didn't provide feedback on any of the papers turned in. Each week you are given a PowerPoint and sheets to fill in notes, an assignment that usually takes about an hour at most to complete, two papers through the semester and three tests no lockdown. The content isn't difficult but she is hard to reach

Awesome class, I took her class online and I would take it again if I could ! Not many assignments, and the assignments we had were short and easy to complete. Her powerpoints were informative and had all the information for tests. I never had any problems in the course and it is easy to get an A.

Very easy professor, she only assigns two papers, weekly discussion (no replies), and a final exam. You're graded by that and attendance. If you show up to the lectures, you'll pass 100%. Her final was very easy and her material is very hard to forget. She is a very caring professor and she loves to hear students talk. Take her and you'll pass.

Her online class has weekly discussions, which are essentially simple questions. Including the final, there are three major assignments. Dr. Dow is a lenient grader and looks for effort. Her PowerPoints reflect the textbook, so you probably won't need to buy it. Plus, she tells you what you need to know for the final. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Caring--Clear grading criteria

comment: By far the best professor I have ever had. She cares about the subject and wants to make the learning environment as safe and entertaining as possible. The lectures were mainly discussion based and we were always prepared for exams. Absolutely phenomenal! I wish she taught more courses, I would take every last one of them.
